reviews.review_msg: Cracks a lot of jokes that flop in a cute way... Very nice guy, fair marker. Good lecturer, a decent charming man. For the most part he's a pretty average prof, nothing too particular stand out. A good prof nonetheless...
No Comments
Engaging, and committed to helping his students learn. Very personable, and knows how to reach students. Made me want to start writing again, inside and outside of the classroom.

This prof is my favourite so far at SFU. Her lectures were interesting and engaging, she was funny and brought props to help people remember specific events, organized a live performance and overall rocked. She also gave sample exams and potential exam questions ahead of time and assigned minimal reading, no reason not to do well in this class.

Horrible professor. Breaking up the large lecture hall into groups for discussions useless to the text and then not even asking about conclusions. An entire class dedicated to some folk singers. This isn't high school I'm paying for this! Completely unclear as to guidelines for papers.

Fantastic professor, for those whoa re already strong in English.  Will spend essentialy unlimited time with her students. VERY nice person.  Hard marker, steer clear if you're not a strong essay writer.  If you don't mind an average grade, she WILL make you a better writer, though.  High standards, but she gets it done.  Best English Prof at SFU.

Open-book quizzes with asynchronous lectures. Really organized with Canvas and email. Content can be tough to grasp but Betty teaches us to think critically. I recommend taking her class after youve taken a few SFU English courses beforehand. As the reviewer below said, she will not hold your hand but she will do her best to help you succeed.

The assignments were pretty straightforward and Betty offers examples of what she wants. She also gave us flexibility with our evaluations which was nice. She is really helpful in office hours and answers emails really fast. I really enjoyed this class and I would recommend taking it if you actually want to learn how to read and write.

She has a high interest in the course material but everyone is right- she seems more into relaying the history of the period than getting into the actual works. The midterm was...Bettyesque and more than half the class misunderstood the essay q resulting in low marks.

She's all over the place and spends most of her lecture time on material she didn't assign for reading. She really focuses on the history and doesn't really cover the actual readings that are required. Her tests are really off too, with obscure, vague essay topics. To top it off, she's boring in lecture.

I enjoyed Schellenberg's lectures; she's comprehensive, open to discussion, but has a definite ground to stand on.  However, the subject material was often appalling, as the class was analysis for context, not content.  There were 6 or 7 good works, all in the first quarter of the class or so.

VERY high standards, tough marker. Does focus alot on history. But, in the end i got a good mark because i approached her for essay ideas and she gave alot of help. She is nice if she knows your working your ass off.
205 talks about hell enough without having to make it a hermeneutic experience.  sympathy for the devil is one thing, betty schellenberg another.
not too exciting but very straightforward..good

Acted way too intellectual. You often become lost as he swings past things he expects you should know and understand without explaining them. However, definately not an eye sore. And his exam format is good.

He expects a lot from his students, and I congratulate him for his optimism. Honestly though, at times it feels like he thinks he's lecturing a 300 level class, but 204 and 205 ARE designed to "make or break" English students. He's also VERY VER

too intellectual. he has to realize that we're not all at the same level as him and try and use SIMPLER words. i found it was really hard to understand him. also the material was BORING if i knew it would be like this, i never would have taken this course
knows what he's talking about and isn't easy... makes you explain what you say, imagine that.
He's a smart guy and knows his material. However, he can be a jerk and is a picky marker.
very entertaining, but difficult material
knows what he's talking about. very funny in tutorials. great teacher
No Comments
No Comments
Helpful, funny, very smart. Kinda cute but older.

I went to her office hours 6/7 times during the semester and spoke in class. However, on the first day of class I mentioned that I would be missing the editing class because my partner was graduating from police acadamy. She said to bad, my grade would reflect this. Received a c+ in attendance ( I only missed the 1 class). - absurd in my opinion.

Taking this class is much like taking 3 classes in one (English, History, Philosophy. Expect to participate a lot and work in groups. She takes attendance. Allows students to do their grade weighting. Final exam is very difficult as there are no clues to the essay question which means one has to study a high portion of readings in great detail.

Professor Solomon is a really great prof that I'd highly recommend! Her lectures were organized and she made it easy to recognize the key points of each reading. Our grade is only based off of 1 essay and the final, so the workload was nothing compared to other classes. Also very approachable!

Dr. Solomon animates the 18th century in her own quirky way. The textbook will be used 100%. Miss a class? That's okay. Dr. Solomon records all of her lectures that are great for review. She won't pull any surprises for exams. I would take a class with her again.

She's really friendly, and I enjoyed her lectures. She marks harder on the essays, but her exams are really easy. She's really sympathetic towards your learning situations and tries to make the course best for you. I hope she makes the course more in-depth to the texts, but considering this is only a 200lvl course, it's not a problem.
I agree with what everyone has said. She's fantastic and super passionate about the 18th century. Best English class I've ever taken.

Dr. Solomon's great! She's really renewed my love for literature! She makes her analyses look so easy because she's so understandable. She has a way of explaining the texts so clearly and with such interesting background. She really wants her students to succeed. She's extremely helpful and fun to listen to. And so nice!

Her classes are easy as long as you do your assignments and review the lecture material before exams. Her exams have no surprises. She tells you exactly what's going to be on it and what you have to study. She's pretty anal regarding tutorial attendance though so make sure you don't skip that!
One of the best English profs I've had!  Her lectures are always interesting and well prepared.  I completely recommend her.  :)
Interesting, funny, and definitely knows her stuff. Lectures are engaging and fun. Workload and marking are fair. I recommend this course for anyone interested/majoring in English.

Dr. Solomon is fantastic!  Her lectures and assignments are always clear (not to mention very doable).  She almost invariably tries to inject a little humour into the class, and she has the students participate in class (which can be a huge relief after doing nothing for hours!).   This is the second class I've had with Diana, and both were great.
Diana is a delight! She is witty, approachable and kind.
